exercise: Create a list of numbers from 1 to 5, then add the number 6 to the end, and finally print the length of the modified list.
Create a list with three fruits, concatenate it with another list containing two vegetables, then modify the first element to be uppercase.
Create an empty list, use a loop to add the numbers 1 through 5, and then slice the list to get just the even numbers.
Create a list containing the square of each number from 1 to 5, then find and print the length and the middle element.
Create a list of three colors, then create a second list of three more colors. Concatenate them and then use indexing to print the first and last color.
Create a list of numbers from 1 to 10, use slicing to get the second half, and then modify one of the elements in the sliced list.
Create a nested list with three inner lists, each containing two numbers. Find the length of the outer list and the length of one of the inner lists.
Create a list with five elements, modify the middle element, and then slice the list to get the first three elements.
Create two lists of equal length, then create a third list that contains elements from both lists alternating. Print the length of the new list.
Create a list of numbers from 1 to 5, reverse it using slicing, and then modify the first element of the reversed list.
Create a list of numbers from 1 to 10, slice it to get only the odd indices, then double each value in the resulting list using a loop.
Create a nested list representing a 3x3 matrix. Modify one element, then extract the first row and calculate its sum.
Create a list of strings, filter out the ones that have a length less than 5, and then concatenate the remaining strings with a space between each one.
Create a list containing sublists of increasing sizes from 1 to 5. Print the length of the outer list and the length of each inner list.
Create a list of numbers, use slicing to get the first half in ascending order, and the second half in descending order, then concatenate these two parts.
Create a list of words, then create a new list containing only the first letter of each word, and finally join these letters to form a single string.
Create two lists of equal length. Combine them to create a dictionary where items from the first list are keys and items from the second list are values.
Create a list of numbers from 1 to 20. Use slicing and a loop to create a new list containing only the prime numbers from the original list.
Create a list of numbers, then a second list with the same numbers squared. Combine these into a single nested list where each inner list contains a number and its square.
Create a nested list representing a tic-tac-toe board (3x3). Modify it to show a winning condition, then use slicing to extract and print the winning row or column.
